title: Doctor login redirects to doctor dashboard with specialty KPIs and modules
description: Verifies that after a successful doctor login, the user lands on the doctor dashboard and sees specialty-specific KPI content and sidebar modules.

title: Doctor dashboard loads without manual interaction and shows KPI grid
description: Verifies that navigating to the doctor dashboard results in an automatically rendered KPI grid (no extra user actions required).

steps.description: Click on "Dashboard" / "Inicio" in the sidebar menu

title: Doctor dashboard shows specialty modules in sidebar (navigation targets present)
description: Verifies that the dashboard sidebar exposes the doctor modules expected for a detected specialty (at minimum, core module entries are visible).

title: Fallback behavior: generic dashboard shell and missing specialty notification
description: Verifies that when specialty data cannot be resolved, the dashboard shows a generic shell with fallback modules and a visible notification about missing specialty data.

steps.description: Click on "Perfil" in the sidebar menu
Click on "Dashboard" / "Inicio" in the sidebar menu

title: Dev override: odontologia test parameter loads odontology-specific dashboard content
description: Verifies that using the dev test parameter for odontology causes odontology-specific KPIs/modules to appear on the doctor dashboard.

title: Doctor dashboard remains usable while specialty detection completes (loading state)
description: Verifies that the dashboard shows a visible loading or placeholder state before KPIs/modules render, rather than a blank or broken UI.

steps.description: Wait for element "KPI grid" to appear

title: Sidebar module navigation works after auto-detection (modules are not broken by specialty config)
description: Verifies that after the dashboard loads, the user can access a core module from the sidebar and the app stays in the authenticated doctor area.

steps.description: Click on "Citas" in the sidebar menu
Click on "Dashboard" / "Inicio" in the sidebar menu

title: Doctor dashboard loads and shows KPI cards for detected specialty
description: Verifies an authenticated doctor can reach the specialty dashboard shell and see KPI cards rendered.

steps.description: Verify at least one KPI card is visible

title: Navigate to Appointments module from dashboard sidebar
description: Verifies sidebar module navigation from the specialty dashboard shell loads the Appointments page.

steps.description: Click the "Citas" module in the sidebar

title: Navigate to Patients module from dashboard sidebar
description: Verifies sidebar module navigation from the specialty dashboard shell loads the Patients list page.

steps.description: Click the "Pacientes" module in the sidebar

title: Navigate to Prescriptions module from dashboard sidebar
description: Verifies sidebar module navigation from the specialty dashboard shell loads the Digital Prescriptions page.

steps.description: Click the "Recetas" module in the sidebar

title: Real-time appointments widget/section shows updates indicator
description: Verifies the dashboard exposes a visible real-time updates area for appointments (without simulating backend events).

steps.description: Verify text "Actualizaciones" or "Tiempo real" is visible
Verify an element "Actualizaciones" or "Tiempo real" section is visible

title: KPI loading state is shown while KPIs resolve
description: Verifies KPI area shows a visible loading state before KPI cards finish rendering.

steps.description: Verify at least one KPI card is visible

title: KPI error state provides actionable message and retry option
description: Verifies that when KPIs cannot be loaded, the dashboard shows a visible error message with a retry action (if it occurs).

steps.description: Wait for the KPI area to finish initial loading
Verify text "Error" or "No se pudieron cargar" is visible
Verify element "Reintentar" or "Retry" button is visible

title: Pull-to-refresh reloads KPI data
description: Verifies the dashboard pull-to-refresh interaction triggers KPI reload and returns to a loaded KPI state.

steps.description: Scroll to the top of the dashboard content
Click the "Actualizar" or refresh control for KPIs (pull-to-refresh equivalent if present)

title: Dashboard sidebar navigation to Messaging module works
description: Verifies the messaging module can be opened from the specialty dashboard shell using the sidebar.

steps.description: Click the "Mensajería" module in the sidebar

title: Odontology doctor sees dental dashboard KPIs after login redirect
description: Verifies that after a successful doctor login, the system redirects to the doctor dashboard and shows odontology-specific KPI cards.

title: Open Periodontograma module and view periodontogram viewer
description: Verifies that an odontology doctor can open the Periodontograma module from the dashboard sidebar and see the periodontogram viewer and dental record area.

steps.description: Click on "Periodontograma" in the sidebar menu

title: From odontology dashboard, open Dental Imaging module and view images list
description: Verifies that the Dental Imaging module opens and displays a list/grid of available dental images for viewing.

steps.description: Click on "Dental Imaging" / "Imágenes" in the sidebar menu
Verify element "Lista de imágenes" is visible

title: Dental Imaging shows treatment estimates section when opened
description: Verifies that the Dental Imaging view includes a visible treatment estimate area for odontology workflows.

steps.description: Click on "Dental Imaging" / "Imágenes" in the sidebar menu

title: Odontology dashboard sidebar contains Periodontograma and Dental Imaging entries
description: Verifies that when odontology specialty is detected, the sidebar exposes the dental modules required for the workflow.

title: Create a new appointment and see it appear on the calendar
description: Verifies a doctor can create an appointment and it becomes visible in the appointments calendar.

steps.description: Click on "Citas" / "Appointments" in the doctor dashboard navigation

title: Create appointment with valid details and confirm it is visible
description: Verifies saving valid appointment details adds a visible appointment item in the calendar.

steps.description: Click on "Citas" / "Appointments" in the doctor dashboard navigation
Fill "Consulta de prueba E2E" into the appointment reason/title field

title: Switch between daily, weekly, and monthly calendar views
description: Verifies the calendar supports changing view modes and shows the selected view state.

steps.description: Click on "Citas" / "Appointments" in the doctor dashboard navigation

title: Monthly view selection is reflected on screen
description: Verifies selecting the monthly view updates the visible view indicator.

steps.description: Click on "Citas" / "Appointments" in the doctor dashboard navigation

title: Attempt to save an appointment with missing required fields and see validation
description: Verifies the UI prevents saving when required fields are missing and shows visible guidance.

steps.description: Click on "Citas" / "Appointments" in the doctor dashboard navigation

title: Attempt to save an appointment with conflicting/invalid scheduling data
description: Verifies entering conflicting or invalid scheduling information shows a visible validation error and does not create the appointment.

Fill "00:00" into the appointment time field

title: Successful login as medico shows medico dashboard
description: Verifies a doctor can sign in and reach the medico dashboard with the correct role.

title: Paciente attempting to access medico dashboard is blocked with 403 guidance
description: Verifies a patient role cannot access the doctor dashboard and sees a forbidden page with guidance.

steps.description: Click on a navigation option or link labeled "Ir al dashboard del médico" (or similar medico dashboard link if present)
Verify text "Ir a tu dashboard" is visible

title: Paciente is guided to their own dashboard from 403 page
description: Verifies the forbidden page provides a working path to the correct dashboard for the signed-in role.

steps.description: Click on a navigation option or link labeled "Dashboard médico" (or similar medico dashboard link if present) to trigger the forbidden page

title: Authenticated medico can navigate to another medico section without being redirected
description: Verifies that once signed in as medico, protected medico routes remain accessible without being sent to login.

title: Authenticated medico can access profile page (role-protected route)
description: Verifies the medico role can access another protected dashboard route that should remain within the medico area.

title: Doctor login fails with invalid credentials and does not reach dashboard
description: Verifies the login page rejects invalid credentials and the user remains on the login flow.

title: Patient login fails with invalid credentials and does not reach patient dashboard
description: Verifies the patient login page rejects invalid credentials and does not allow access to authenticated dashboards.

title: Successful SACS verification shows verified badge and completed profile status
description: Verifies a doctor can submit a valid cédula, receive success feedback, and see a verified badge and completed professional profile indicators.

steps.description: Click on "Perfil" in the dashboard navigation
Verify text "Perfil profesional completado" is visible

title: SACS verification failure shows explanatory error and retry guidance
description: Verifies that an invalid or non-matching cédula results in a visible failure message with next steps to retry or contact support.

steps.description: Click on "Perfil" in the dashboard navigation
Verify text "No se pudo verificar" is visible
Verify text "Intenta de nuevo" is visible

title: Client-side validation blocks verification when cédula is empty
description: Verifies the cédula field is required and the UI shows a validation error without proceeding when the user clicks Verify with an empty field.

steps.description: Click on "Perfil" in the dashboard navigation
Verify text "Ingresa tu cédula" is visible
Verify element "cédula field error message" is visible

title: Non-numeric cédula input is rejected or prompts a validation message
description: Verifies the UI handles non-numeric cédula input by showing a visible validation error and not showing a verified state.

steps.description: Click on "Perfil" in the dashboard navigation

title: Cédula with leading/trailing spaces is handled correctly
description: Verifies the verification flow works (or clearly errors) when the user enters a cédula with extra spaces, and the UI provides clear feedback.

steps.description: Click on "Perfil" in the dashboard navigation

title: Verification in progress shows a visible loading state
description: Verifies that after clicking Verify, the UI shows an in-progress indicator while verification is happening, preventing unclear double submissions.

steps.description: Click on "Perfil" in the dashboard navigation
Verify element "verification loading indicator" is visible

title: After successful verification, the verified badge is visible on the profile page
description: Verifies the verified state persists within the session by navigating to the profile page and confirming the badge is visible.
